content:
Love it! Just got it in Fastest mode, and all the answers submitted by the clashers were different!

I chose to have a number_of_slimes variables, a number_of_hits variable, and at every iteration, I divide h by two while incrementing number_of_hits by number_of_slimes and doubling number_of_slimes.

Another Clasher chose to maintain a list of slimes.

Another Clasher used the same recurrence relation as you to write a recursive function,
req(h) = 1+2*req(h//2).

After submitting my answer to the clash I thought about it some more and found a more explicit formula: the number of hits required is the next power of two minus one.
k = 1; while (k <= h) { k <<= 1; } print(k-1);

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Conveying a simple, yet fun challenge in a creative way.

Approved :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one

Nice idea!

Personally, I would write the "1"-s in the first and second condition in the Statement as {{1}} constraints.

I think that it would be good for shortest mode as well.

Anyway, good looking clash.
Thanks for the feedback. Glad you liked it.
